page.title: 11Colmonell Covenanters
page.content: Three Covenanter graves are said to lie in the local churchyard.The most prominent of these is the grave of Matthew McIlwraith. Matthew was the son of a local farmer at nearby Barrhill who was courting a Miss McEwan of Barbour farm.While Matthew and the McEwan family were worshiping one night in Barbour they were surrounded by Dragoons.Matthew escaped and was chased to Dangart, where he was wounded and later shot. Two young women found the body and transported it to Colmonell churchyard where they buried it where it lies to this day. In the hills to the south of the village on the banks of the Tig stands an outcrop of rock known as Pedens Pulpit where the famous Covenanter was said to have preached.
